definitions.definition: To move backwards to an earlier stage; to devolve .

subdefinitions.definition: To re-develop behavior one had previously grown out of , particularly a behavior left behind in childhood .
examples: Your nightmares stopped when you were eight years old, but after the house burned down, you regressed .

definitions.definition: To move in the retrograde direction. (clarification of this definition is needed)
To reduce in severity or size (as of a tumor ), without reaching total remission .
To perform a regression on an explanatory variable.
examples: When we regress Y on X, we use the values of variable X to predict those of Y.

definitions.definition: To interrogate a person in a state of trance about forgotten elements of their past.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To move backwards to an earlier stage; to devolve .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , astronomy ) To move in the retrograde direction. (clarification of this definition is needed)
( intransitive , medicine ) To reduce in severity or size (as of a tumor ), without reaching total remission .
( transitive , statistics ) To perform a regression on an explanatory variable.
( transitive ) To interrogate a person in a state of trance about forgotten elements of their past.
